1. Recoding the methylation data to 0,1,2

```{r}
library(data.table)
meth=fread("/common/jyanglab/shared/Gen_Xu/07-08-2019-mr_100bptile/CG_meth.txt",head=T,data.table=F)
d=meth[,1:3]
for(i in 4:ncol(meth))
{
  meth[which(meth[,i]<0.3),i]=0
  meth[which(meth[,i]>0.7),i]=2
  meth[which(meth[,i]>=0.3 & meth[,i]<=0.7),i]=1
  cat(i,"\n")
}
write.table(meth,file="/common/jyanglab/shared/Gen_Xu/07-08-2019-mr_100bptile/CG_meth_012.txt",row.names = F,col.names = T,sep="\t",quote=F)

```

2. calculate methylation epiallele frequency

```{r}
# methylation epiallele frequency
mef=function(x)
{
  x=x[which(!is.na(x))]
  f0=length(which(x==0))
  f1=length(which(x==1))
  f2=length(which(x==2))
  (f1+2*f2)/(2*length(x)) ###need to check the formula.
}

library("data.table")
meth=fread("/common/jyanglab/shared/Gen_Xu/07-08-2019-mr_100bptile/CG_meth_012.txt", head=T, data.table=F)

meth$mef <- apply(meth[,-c(1:3)], 1, mef)

nrow(meth[meth$mef==0,]) # 8109078
nrow(meth[meth$mef==1,]) # 3460536
nrow(meth[meth$mef >= 0.90 & meth$mef < 1,]) #3454158
nrow(meth[meth$mef <= 0.10 & meth$mef > 0,]) #16160395
nrow(meth[meth$mef > 0.10 & meth$mef < 0.90,]) #3695842

```

3. Convert to bed format

```{r}
d1=na.omit(meth[meth$mef==0, 1:3])
d1[,2]=d1[,2]-1
fwrite(d1, file="CG_Completely_unmeth.bed", row.names = F, col.names = F, sep="\t", quote=F)

## mef ==1, completely methylated tiles
d2=na.omit(meth[mef==1, 1:3])
d2[,2]=d2[,2]-1
fwrite(d2, file="CG_Completely_meth.bed", row.names = F, col.names = F, sep="\t", quote=F)

## mef > 0.9 or mef < 0.1, rare epialleles
d3=na.omit(meth[mef>0.9 | mef<0.1, 1:3])
d3[,2]=d3[,2]-1
fwrite(d3, file="CG_Rare_epi.bed", row.names = F, col.names = F, sep="\t", quote=F)

## mef > 0.1 and mef < 0.8, common epialleles
d4=na.omit(meth[mef>0.1 & mef<0.8, 1:3])
d4[,2]=d4[,2]-1
fwrite(d4, file="CG_Common_epi.bed", row.names = F, col.names = F, sep="\t", quote=F)

```
